text: Damaris Berta Egurrola Wienke (born 26 August 1999) is a professional footballer who plays as a Defensive Midfielder for English FA Women's Super League Club Everton. At club level, she made her debut with Athletic Bilbao in 2015 and departed in 2020. Born in the United States, she made her senior debut for the Spain national team in 2019. ==Club career== ===Early life=== Egurrola spent her early childhood in Orlando, Florida, the second of three children born to a Dutch mother and a Spanish-Basque father (Pablo Egurrola Osa,Osa II, Zesta Puntaren Lagunak (in Spanish) a professional pelotari competing in American Jai Alai leagues);La hija del pelotari [The pelotari's daughter], El País, 18 December 2019 (in Spanish) when he retired in 2006, the family emigrated to his homeland in eastern Biscay in Spain's Basque Country. Damaris became a polyglot, speaking Spanish, English, Basque and Dutch to a high standard. ===Athletic Bilbao=== After playing youth football at clubs in the Gernika area, Egurrola – who also showed a talent for tennis – signed for Athletic Bilbao in 2012, aged 12, meeting the club's selective signing criteria due to her local upbringing. Following three years at affiliated lower-division clubs, including Betiko Neskak in Erandio and the Athletic B-team, she made her senior team debut in December 2015, making six appearances in the 2015–16 Primera División as Athletic finished as champions, and became a regular from then on. Along with teammate and friend Maite Oroz,Damaris and Maite Oroz, an inseparable couple, Athletic Bilbao, 29 December 2019 she decided to leave the club when her contract expired in summer 2020.Athletic Club Bilbao will feel the losses of Maite Oroz and Damaris Egurrola, Vavel, 30 March 2020 In July 2020, a court case regarding the legality of 'compensation lists' for players in Spanish women's football confirmed that a new employer would not have to pay a fee to Athletic Bilbao. ==International career== Egurrola was involved with Spanish national age-group teams at several levels and with much success, being a member of the under-17 squad that claimed the silver medal at the 2016 UEFA Women's Under-17 Championship and bronze at the 2016 FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup; the under-19 squad which won the 2017 UEFA Women's Under-19 Championship, (using her height to score a header in the final victory over France) – she also helped the 19s to qualify for the 2018 edition which they again won, but had moved to the higher age group by the time of the finals tournament – and the under-20 squad who were runners-up at the 2018 FIFA U-20 Women's World Cup.Japan cruise to maiden world title, FIFA, 24 August 2018 She made her Spain senior debut in May 2019, aged 19, appearing as a substitute for the closing minutes of a 4–0 friendly win over Cameroon in the build-up to the 2019 FIFA Women's World Cup, although she was not selected in the eventual finals squad.Embaladas hacia el Mundial (4–0) [Packed for the World Cup (4-0)], Royal Spanish Football Federation, 17 May 2019 (in Spanish) In October 2019, she was called up to the inaugural squad for España Promesas (essentially Spain B), along with two clubmates.Oroz, Azkona and Damaris, with the Spanish Promesas, Athletic Bilbao, 30 October 2019Oficial: La RFEF crea la Selección Absoluta Promesas, una nueva selección femenina de fútbol (Official: The RFEF creates the Absolute Promises Selection, a new women's team), SEfutbol (in Spanish), 29 October 2019 She has also played for the unofficial Basque Country team.Euskal Selekzioa 2–1 Chequia, Basque Football Federation, 25 November 2017 (in Basque) ==References== ==External links== * Category:Living people Category:1999 births Category:Spanish women's footballers Category:Basque footballers Category:American women's soccer players Category:American emigrants to Spain Category:Spanish people of Dutch descent Category:American people of Dutch descent Category:Women's association football midfielders Category:Sportspeople from Orlando, Florida Category:People from Busturialdea Category:Athletic Club Femenino players Category:Primera División (women) players Category:Spain women's international footballers Category:Soccer players from Florida
title: Damaris Egurrola
